content.webTitle: Outsourcing widens IT workers' pay divide

fields.headline: Outsourcing widens IT workers' pay divide
fields.bodyText: The wages of IT helpdesk staff in Britain have dropped by almost 10% in the past year while IT consultant pay has risen by a similar magnitude, according to a report from iProfileStats/ATSCo. It says the drop in helpdesk pay was a direct result of the outsourcing of many functions to countries such as India. The drop was as much as 25% for temporary helpdesk staff, who now earn an average of £12 an hour, while permanent staff suffered a 3% fall in average salaries, to £17,538. By contrast, some skilled IT consultants, such as security experts, enjoyed a rise of 22% in pay this year.
